summary: This is a U.S. Attorney's Office form requesting travel arrangements for a fact witness to appear at the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in the Southern District of New York. The witness is scheduled to be in New York from December 2 to December 7, 2021, for trial testimony beginning December 3, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the travel request form (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell).

persons.name: Ed Tyrrell
persons.context: Mentioned in the form's instructions as a contact for guidance on witness travel funding for investigative interviews.

events.title: Witness Arrival for Maxwell Trial
events.description: A fact witness arrives in New York in the evening in preparation for trial testimony.

events.title: Witness Scheduled Trial Testimony
events.description: A fact witness is scheduled to appear in court at 12:30 PM for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Witness Departure
events.description: The fact witness is scheduled to depart New York in the evening after completing trial-related obligations.

keyFacts: The document is a travel request form for a fact witness to testify at the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in December 2021.
The witness's personal details (name, DOB, address) are not filled in on this version of the form, indicating it is a template or a partially redacted copy.
The witness is explicitly identified as a fact witness, not an expert witness, victim-witness, or someone facing criminal charges.
The travel is authorized under the FEWS appropriation specifically for grand jury testimony, court testimony, or preparation for same.
The form references DOJ Instruction 1300.01.01 and a contact, Ed Tyrrell, for guidance on travel funding rules.
